scene.name: intro
scene.line: The cave wall is uncommonly flat here. A tall ladder leans against the wall. At the top, a small figure taps away at something.

option.insertedText: Junebug pulls the bike next to the ladder.
Junebug stays on the highway, following the truck.

scene.name: approach
scene.line: The woman at the top of the ladder seems unperturbed, focused on her work.

option.insertedText: Johnny switches to a telescopic lens.

scene.name: record
scene.line: The woman repeats a cycle of noisy gestures: shuffle, glob, scrape, silence, tap, tap, tap, tap, shuffle ...

option.insertedText: Johnny switches to a telescopic lens.

scene.name: telescope
scene.line: She has a pile of small, brightly-painted clay tiles next to her on the ladder. She sticks each one to the wall with some kind of mortar or glue, inspects it, then taps gently at its edges with a small hammer until it is fixed in place.
She's only a few dozen tiles along. Too early to guess what kind of image might be taking shape.
This recording can go in the "art and artists" drawer.

scene.name: record-longer
scene.line: Johnny closes his eyes. This is the best part: statically listening while recording. Empathy with the machine.
This recording can go in the "art and artists" drawer.
